data.name: CVE-1999-1380
data.document: Symantec Norton Utilities 2.0 for Windows 95 marks the TUNEOCX.OCX ActiveX control as safe for scripting, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via the run option through malicious web pages that are accessed by browsers such as Internet Explorer 3.0.

data.name: CVE-1999-1186
data.document: rxvt, when compiled with the PRINT_PIPE option in various Linux operating systems including Linux Slackware 3.0 and RedHat 2.1, allows local users to gain root privileges by specifying a malicious program using the -print-pipe command line parameter.

data.name: CVE-1999-1098
data.document: Vulnerability in BSD Telnet client with encryption and Kerberos 4 authentication allows remote attackers to decrypt the session via sniffing.

data.name: CVE-1999-0145
data.document: Sendmail WIZ command enabled, allowing root access.

data.name: CVE-1999-1238
data.document: Vulnerability in CORE-DIAG fileset in HP message catalog in HP-UX 9.05 and earlier allows local users to gain privileges.

data.name: CVE-1999-1067
data.document: SGI MachineInfo CGI program, installed by default on some web servers, prints potentially sensitive system status information, which could be used by remote attackers for information gathering activities.

data.name: CVE-1999-1267
data.document: KDE file manager (kfm) uses a TCP server for certain file operations, which allows remote attackers to modify arbitrary files by sending a copy command to the server.

data.name: CVE-1999-0299
data.document: Buffer overflow in FreeBSD lpd through long DNS hostnames.

data.name: CVE-1999-1239
data.document: HP-UX 9.x does not properly enable the Xauthority mechanism in certain conditions, which could allow local users to access the X display even when they have not explicitly been authorized to do so.

data.name: CVE-1999-0423
data.document: Vulnerability in hpterm on HP-UX 10.20 allows local users to gain additional privileges.

data.name: CVE-1999-0112
data.document: Buffer overflow in AIX dtterm program for the CDE.

data.name: CVE-1999-0161
data.document: In Cisco IOS 10.3, with the tacacs-ds or tacacs keyword, an extended IP access control list could bypass filtering.

data.name: CVE-1999-1302
data.document: Unspecified vulnerability in pt_chmod in SCO UNIX 4.2 and earlier allows local users to gain root access.

data.name: CVE-1999-1305
data.document: Vulnerability in "at" program in SCO UNIX 4.2 and earlier allows local users to gain root access.

data.name: CVE-1999-1580
data.document: SunOS sendmail 5.59 through 5.65 uses popen to process a forwarding host argument, which allows local users to gain root privileges by modifying the IFS (Internal Field Separator) variable and passing crafted values to the -oR option.

data.name: CVE-1999-1135
data.document: Vulnerability in VUE 3.0 in HP 9.x allows local users to gain root privileges, as fixed by PHSS_4994 and PHSS_5438.

data.name: CVE-1999-0039
data.document: webdist CGI program (webdist.cgi) in SGI IRIX allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in the distloc parameter.

data.name: CVE-1999-1491
data.document: abuse.console in Red Hat 2.1 uses relative pathnames to find and execute the undrv program, which allows local users to execute arbitrary commands via a path that points to a Trojan horse program.

data.name: CVE-1999-1410
data.document: addnetpr in IRIX 5.3 and 6.2 allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files and possibly gain root privileges via a symlink attack on the printers temporary file.

data.name: CVE-1999-1494
data.document: colorview in Silicon Graphics IRIX 5.1, 5.2, and 6.0 allows local attackers to read arbitrary files via the -text argument.

data.name: CVE-1999-0309
data.document: HP-UX vgdisplay program gives root access to local users.

data.name: CVE-1999-1449
data.document: SunOS 4.1.4 on a Sparc 20 machine allows local users to cause a denial of service (kernel panic) by reading from the /dev/tcx0 TCX device.

data.name: CVE-1999-1296
data.document: Buffer overflow in Kerberos IV compatibility libraries as used in Kerberos V allows local users to gain root privileges via a long line in a kerberos configuration file, which can be specified via the KRB_CONF environmental variable.

data.name: CVE-1999-0075
data.document: PASV core dump in wu-ftpd daemon when attacker uses a QUOTE PASV command after specifying a username and password.

data.name: CVE-1999-1304
data.document: Vulnerability in login in SCO UNIX 4.2 and earlier allows local users to gain root access.

data.name: CVE-1999-1184
data.document: Buffer overflow in Elm 2.4 and earlier allows local users to gain privileges via a long TERM environmental variable.

data.name: CVE-1999-0369
data.document: The Sun sdtcm_convert calendar utility for OpenWindows has a buffer overflow which can gain root access.

data.name: CVE-1999-1385
data.document: Buffer overflow in ppp program in FreeBSD 2.1 and earlier allows local users to gain privileges via a long HOME environment variable.

data.name: CVE-1999-1080
data.document: rmmount in SunOS 5.7 may mount file systems without the nosuid flag set, contrary to the documentation and its use in previous versions of SunOS, which could allow local users with physical access to gain root privileges by mounting a floppy or CD-ROM that contains a setuid program and running volcheck, when the file systems do not have the nosuid option specified in rmmount.conf.

data.name: CVE-1999-1191
data.document: Buffer overflow in chkey in Solaris 2.5.1 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges via a long command line argument.

data.name: CVE-1999-1161
data.document: Vulnerability in ppl in HP-UX 10.x and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges by forcing ppl to core dump.

data.name: CVE-1999-1461
data.document: inpview in InPerson on IRIX 5.3 through IRIX 6.5.10 trusts the PATH environmental variable to find and execute the ttsession program, which allows local users to obtain root access by modifying the PATH to point to a Trojan horse ttsession program.

data.name: CVE-1999-1303
data.document: Vulnerability in prwarn in SCO UNIX 4.2 and earlier allows local users to gain root access.

data.name: CVE-1999-0211
data.document: Extra long export lists over 256 characters in some mount daemons allows NFS directories to be mounted by anyone.

data.name: CVE-1999-1402
data.document: The access permissions for a UNIX domain socket are ignored in Solaris 2.x and SunOS 4.x, and other BSD-based operating systems before 4.4, which could allow local users to connect to the socket and possibly disrupt or control the operations of the program using that socket.

data.name: CVE-1999-1232
data.document: Untrusted search path vulnerability in day5datacopier in SGI IRIX 6.2 allows local users to execute arbitrary commands via a modified PATH environment variable that points to a malicious cp program.

data.name: CVE-1999-0311
data.document: fpkg2swpk in HP-UX allows local users to gain root access.

data.name: CVE-1999-1525
data.document: Macromedia Shockwave before 6.0 allows a malicious webmaster to read a user's mail box and possibly access internal web servers via the GetNextText command on a Shockwave movie.

data.name: CVE-1999-0308
data.document: HP-UX gwind program allows users to modify arbitrary files.

data.name: CVE-1999-1319
data.document: Vulnerability in object server program in SGI IRIX 5.2 through 6.1 allows remote attackers to gain root privileges in certain configurations.

data.name: CVE-1999-1022
data.document: serial_ports administrative program in IRIX 4.x and 5.x trusts the user's PATH environmental variable to find and execute the ls program, which allows local users to gain root privileges via a Trojan horse ls program.

data.name: CVE-1999-0113
data.document: Some implementations of rlogin allow root access if given a -froot parameter.

data.name: CVE-1999-1216
data.document: Cisco routers 9.17 and earlier allow remote attackers to bypass security restrictions via certain IP source routed packets that should normally be denied using the "no ip source-route" command.

data.name: CVE-1999-1552
data.document: dpsexec (DPS Server) when running under XDM in IBM AIX 3.2.5 and earlier does not properly check privileges, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files and gain privileges.

data.name: CVE-1999-1219
data.document: Vulnerability in sgihelp in the SGI help system and print manager in IRIX 5.2 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges, possibly through the clogin command.

data.name: CVE-1999-0315
data.document: Buffer overflow in Solaris fdformat command gives root access to local users.

data.name: CVE-1999-0962
data.document: Buffer overflow in HPUX passwd command allows local users to gain root privileges via a command line option.

data.name: CVE-1999-1221
data.document: dxchpwd in Digital Unix (OSF/1) 3.x allows local users to modify arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the dxchpwd.log file.

data.name: CVE-1999-0120
data.document: Sun/Solaris utmp file allows local users to gain root access if it is writable by users other than root.

data.name: CVE-1999-1128
data.document: Internet Explorer 3.01 on Windows 95 allows remote malicious web sites to execute arbitrary commands via a .isp file, which is automatically downloaded and executed without prompting the user.

data.name: CVE-1999-0077
data.document: Predictable TCP sequence numbers allow spoofing.

data.name: CVE-1999-0032
data.document: Buffer overflow in lpr, as used in BSD-based systems including Linux, allows local users to execute arbitrary code as root via a long -C (classification) command line option.

data.name: CVE-1999-1408
data.document: Vulnerability in AIX 4.1.4 and HP-UX 10.01 and 9.05 allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) by using a socket to connect to a port on the localhost, calling shutdown to clear the socket, then using the same socket to connect to a different port on localhost.

data.name: CVE-1999-0164
data.document: A race condition in the Solaris ps command allows an attacker to overwrite critical files.

data.name: CVE-1999-1138
data.document: SCO UNIX System V/386 Release 3.2, and other SCO products, installs the home directories (1) /tmp for the dos user, and (2) /usr/tmp for the asg user, which allows other users to gain access to those accounts since /tmp and /usr/tmp are world-writable.

data.name: CVE-1999-0149
data.document: The wrap CGI program in IRIX allows remote attackers to view arbitrary directory listings via a .. (dot dot) attack.

data.name: CVE-1999-0961
data.document: HPUX sysdiag allows local users to gain root privileges via a symlink attack during log file creation.

data.name: CVE-1999-1089
data.document: Buffer overflow in chfn command in HP-UX 9.X through 10.20 allows local users to gain privileges via a long command line argument.

data.name: CVE-1999-0044
data.document: fsdump command in IRIX allows local users to obtain root access by modifying sensitive files.

data.name: CVE-1999-1388
data.document: passwd in SunOS 4.1.x allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack and the -F command line argument.

data.name: CVE-1999-0228
data.document: Denial of service in RPCSS.EXE program (RPC Locator) in Windows NT.

data.name: CVE-1999-1398
data.document: Vulnerability in xfsdump in SGI IRIX may allow local users to obtain root privileges via the bck.log log file, possibly via a symlink attack.

data.name: CVE-1999-1318
data.document: /usr/5bin/su in SunOS 4.1.3 and earlier uses a search path that includes the current working directory (.), which allows local users to gain privileges via Trojan horse programs.

data.name: CVE-1999-0066
data.document: AnyForm CGI remote execution.

data.name: CVE-1999-1243
data.document: SGI Desktop Permissions Tool in IRIX 6.0.1 and earlier allows local users to modify permissions for arbitrary files and gain privileges.

data.name: CVE-1999-0101
data.document: Buffer overflow in AIX and Solaris "gethostbyname" library call allows root access through corrupt DNS host names.

data.name: CVE-1999-1240
data.document: Buffer overflow in cddbd CD database server allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a long log message.

data.name: CVE-1999-1143
data.document: Vulnerability in runtime linker program rld in SGI IRIX 6.x and earlier allows local users to gain privileges via setuid and setgid programs.

data.name: CVE-1999-1215
data.document: LOGIN.EXE program in Novell Netware 4.0 and 4.01 temporarily writes user name and password information to disk, which could allow local users to gain privileges.

data.name: CVE-1999-0959
data.document: IRIX startmidi program allows local users to modify arbitrary files via a symlink attack.

data.name: CVE-1999-1099
data.document: Kerberos 4 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a malformed UDP packet that generates an error string that inadvertently includes the realm name and the last user.

data.name: CVE-1999-1489
data.document: Buffer overflow in TestChip function in XFree86 SuperProbe in Slackware Linux 3.1 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long -nopr argument.

data.name: CVE-1999-1137
data.document: The permissions for the /dev/audio device on Solaris 2.2 and earlier, and SunOS 4.1.x, allow any local user to read from the device, which could be used by an attacker to monitor conversations happening near a machine that has a microphone.

data.name: CVE-1999-1251
data.document: Vulnerability in direct audio user space code on HP-UX 10.20 and 10.10 allows local users to cause a denial of service.

data.name: CVE-1999-1162
data.document: Vulnerability in passwd in SCO UNIX 4.0 and earlier allows attackers to cause a denial of service by preventing users from being able to log into the system.

data.name: CVE-1999-0325
data.document: vhe_u_mnt program in HP-UX allows local users to create root files through symlinks.

data.name: CVE-1999-1286
data.document: addnetpr in SGI IRIX 6.2 and earlier allows local users to modify arbitrary files and possibly gain root access via a symlink attack on a temporary file.

data.name: CVE-1999-1299
data.document: rcp on various Linux systems including Red Hat 4.0 allows a "nobody" user or other user with UID of 65535 to overwrite arbitrary files, since 65535 is interpreted as -1 by chown and other system calls, which causes the calls to fail to modify the ownership of the file.

data.name: CVE-1999-1387
data.document: Windows NT 4.0 SP2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), possibly via malformed inputs or packets, such as those generated by a Linux smbmount command that was compiled on the Linux 2.0.29 kernel but executed on Linux 2.0.25.

data.name: CVE-1999-0096
data.document: Sendmail decode alias can be used to overwrite sensitive files.

data.name: CVE-1999-1384
data.document: Indigo Magic System Tour in the SGI system tour package (systour) for IRIX 5.x through 6.3 allows local users to gain root privileges via a Trojan horse .exitops program, which is called by the inst command that is executed by the RemoveSystemTour program.

data.name: CVE-1999-1134
data.document: Vulnerability in Vue 3.0 in HP 9.x allows local users to gain root privileges, as fixed by PHSS_4038, PHSS_4055, and PHSS_4066.

data.name: CVE-1999-0298
data.document: ypbind with -ypset and -ypsetme options activated in Linux Slackware and SunOS allows local and remote attackers to overwrite files via a .. (dot dot) attack.

data.name: CVE-1999-0109
data.document: Buffer overflow in ffbconfig in Solaris 2.5.1.

data.name: CVE-1999-0036
data.document: IRIX login program with a nonzero LOCKOUT parameter allows creation or damage to files.

data.name: CVE-1999-1146
data.document: Vulnerability in Glance and gpm programs in GlancePlus for HP-UX 9.x and earlier allows local users to access arbitrary files and gain privileges.

data.name: CVE-1999-1248
data.document: Vulnerability in Support Watch (aka SupportWatch) in HP-UX 8.0 through 9.0 allows local users to gain privileges.

data.name: CVE-1999-1158
data.document: Buffer overflow in (1) pluggable authentication module (PAM) on Solaris 2.5.1 and 2.5 and (2) unix_scheme in Solaris 2.4 and 2.3 allows local users to gain root privileges via programs that use these modules such as passwd, yppasswd, and nispasswd.

data.name: CVE-1999-1298
data.document: Sysinstall in FreeBSD 2.2.1 and earlier, when configuring anonymous FTP, creates the ftp user without a password and with /bin/date as the shell, which could allow attackers to gain access to certain system resources.

data.name: CVE-1999-0058
data.document: Buffer overflow in PHP cgi program, php.cgi allows shell access.

data.name: CVE-1999-1116
data.document: Vulnerability in runpriv in Indigo Magic System Administration subsystem of SGI IRIX 6.3 and 6.4 allows local users to gain root privileges.

data.name: CVE-1999-1026
data.document: aspppd on Solaris 2.5 x86 allows local users to modify arbitrary files and gain root privileges via a symlink attack on the /tmp/.asppp.fifo file.

data.name: CVE-1999-0144
data.document: Denial of service in Qmail by specifying a large number of recipients with the RCPT command.

data.name: CVE-1999-1401
data.document: Vulnerability in Desktop searchbook program in IRIX 5.0.x through 6.2 sets insecure permissions for certain user files (iconbook and searchbook).

data.name: CVE-1999-0130
data.document: Local users can start Sendmail in daemon mode and gain root privileges.

data.name: CVE-1999-1141
data.document: Ascom Timeplex router allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information or conduct unauthorized activities by entering debug mode through a sequence of CTRL-D characters.

data.name: CVE-1999-1242
data.document: Vulnerability in subnetconfig in HP-UX 9.01 and 9.0 allows local users to gain privileges.

data.name: CVE-1999-1160
data.document: Vulnerability in ftpd/kftpd in HP-UX 10.x and 9.x allows local and possibly remote users to gain root privileges.

data.name: CVE-2000-0870
data.document: Buffer overflow in EFTP allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a long string.

data.name: CVE-2000-0967
data.document: PHP 3 and 4 do not properly cleanse user-injected format strings, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands by triggering error messages that are improperly written to the error logs.

data.name: CVE-2000-1229
data.document: Directory traversal vulnerability in Phorum 3.0.7 allows remote Phorum administrators to read arbitrary files via ".." (dot dot) sequences in the default .langfile name field in the Master Settings administrative function, which causes the file to be displayed in admin.php3.

data.name: CVE-2000-0937
data.document: Samba Web Administration Tool (SWAT) in Samba 2.0.7 does not log login attempts in which the username is correct but the password is wrong, which allows remote attackers to conduct brute force password guessing attacks.

data.name: CVE-2000-1090
data.document: Microsoft IIS for Far East editions 4.0 and 5.0 allows remote attackers to read source code for parsed pages via a malformed URL that uses the lead-byte of a double-byte character.

data.name: CVE-2000-1170
data.document: Buffer overflow in Netsnap webcam HTTP server before 1.2.9 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a long GET request.

data.name: CVE-2000-1044
data.document: Format string vulnerability in ypbind-mt in SuSE SuSE-6.2, and possibly other Linux operating systems, allows an attacker to gain root privileges.

data.name: CVE-2000-0897
data.document: Small HTTP Server 2.03 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service by repeatedly requesting a URL that references a directory that does not contain an index.html file, which consumes memory that is not released after the request is completed.

data.name: CVE-2000-1013
data.document: The setlocale function in FreeBSD 5.0 and earlier, and possibly other OSes, allows local users to read arbitrary files via the LANG environmental variable.

data.name: CVE-2000-1017
data.document: Webteachers Webdata allows remote attackers with valid Webdata accounts to read arbitrary files by posting a request to import the file into the WebData database.

data.name: CVE-2000-0928
data.document: WQuinn QuotaAdvisor 4.1 allows users to list directories and files by running a report on the targeted shares.

data.name: CVE-2000-1087
data.document: The xp_proxiedmetadata function in Microsoft SQL Server 2000 and SQL Server Desktop Engine (MSDE) does not properly restrict the length of a buffer before calling the srv_paraminfo function in the SQL Server API for Extended Stored Procedures (XP), which allows an attacker to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary commands, aka the "Extended Stored Procedure Parameter Parsing" vulnerability.

data.name: CVE-2000-0993
data.document: Format string vulnerability in pw_error function in BSD libutil library allows local users to gain root privileges via a malformed password in commands such as chpass or passwd.

data.name: CVE-2000-0889
data.document: Two Sun security certificates have been compromised, which could allow attackers to insert malicious code such as applets and make it appear that it is signed by Sun.

data.name: CVE-2000-1020
data.document: Heap overflow in Worldclient in Mdaemon 3.1.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a long URL.

data.name: CVE-2000-1136
data.document: elvis-tiny before 1.4-10 in Debian GNU/Linux, and possibly other Linux operating systems, allows local users to overwrite files of other users via a symlink attack.

data.name: CVE-2000-0309
data.document: The i386 trace-trap handling in OpenBSD 2.4 with DDB enabled allows a local user to cause a denial of service.

data.name: CVE-2000-1126
data.document: Vulnerability in auto_parms and set_parms in HP-UX 11.00 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands or cause a denial of service.

data.name: CVE-2000-0916
data.document: FreeBSD 4.1.1 and earlier, and possibly other BSD-based OSes, uses an insufficient random number generator to generate initial TCP sequence numbers (ISN), which allows remote attackers to spoof TCP connections.

data.name: CVE-2000-0852
data.document: Multiple buffer overflows in eject on FreeBSD and possibly other OSes allows local users to gain root privileges.

data.name: CVE-2000-1109
data.document: Midnight Commander (mc) 4.5.51 and earlier does not properly process malformed directory names when a user opens a directory, which allows other local users to gain privileges by creating directories that contain special characters followed by the commands to be executed.

data.name: CVE-2000-0498
data.document: Unify eWave ServletExec allows a remote attacker to view source code of a JSP program by requesting a URL which provides the JSP extension in upper case.

data.name: CVE-2000-0950
data.document: Format string vulnerability in x-gw in TIS Firewall Toolkit (FWTK) allows local users to execute arbitrary commands via a malformed display name.

data.name: CVE-2000-0886
data.document: IIS 5.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a malformed request for an executable file whose name is appended with operating system commands, aka the "Web Server File Request Parsing" vulnerability.

data.name: CVE-2000-1217
data.document: Microsoft Windows 2000 before Service Pack 2 (SP2), when running in a non-Windows 2000 domain and using NTLM authentication, and when credentials of an account are locally cached, allows local users to bypass account lockout policies and make an unlimited number of login attempts, aka the "Domain Account Lockout" vulnerability.

data.name: CVE-2000-1164
data.document: WinVNC installs the WinVNC3 registry key with permissions that give Special Access (read and modify) to the Everybody group, which allows users to read and modify sensitive information such as passwords and gain access to the system.

data.name: CVE-2000-0977
data.document: mailfile.cgi CGI program in MailFile 1.10 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files by specifying the target file name in the "filename" parameter in a POST request, which is then sent by email to the address specified in the "email" parameter.

data.name: CVE-2000-1232
data.document: upgrade.php3 in Phorum 3.0.7 could allow remote attackers to modify certain Phorum database tables via an unknown method.

data.name: CVE-2000-1027
data.document: Cisco Secure PIX Firewall 5.2(2) allows remote attackers to determine the real IP address of a target FTP server by flooding the server with PASV requests, which includes the real IP address in the response when passive mode is established.

data.name: CVE-2000-1055
data.document: Buffer overflow in CiscoSecure ACS Server 2.4(2) and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a large TACACS+ packet.

data.name: CVE-2000-1031
data.document: Buffer overflow in dtterm in HP-UX 11.0 and HP Tru64 UNIX 4.0f through 5.1a allows local users to execute arbitrary code via a long -tn option.

data.name: CVE-2000-1010
data.document: Format string vulnerability in talkd in OpenBSD and possibly other BSD-based OSes allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a user name that contains format characters.

data.name: CVE-2000-1142
data.document: Recourse ManTrap 1.6 generates an error when an attacker cd's to /proc/self/cwd and executes the pwd command, which allows attackers to determine that they are in a honeypot system.

data.name: CVE-2000-1144
data.document: Recourse ManTrap 1.6 sets up a chroot environment to hide the fact that it is running, but the inode number for the resulting "/" file system is higher than normal, which allows attackers to determine that they are in a chroot environment.

data.name: CVE-2000-0863
data.document: Buffer overflow in listmanager earlier than 2.105.1 allows local users to gain additional privileges.

data.name: CVE-2000-1038
data.document: The web administration interface for IBM AS/400 Firewall allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via an empty GET request.

data.name: CVE-2000-0945
data.document: The web configuration interface for Catalyst 3500 XL switches allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands without authentication when the enable password is not set, via a URL containing the /exec/ directory.

data.name: CVE-2000-0968
data.document: Buffer overflow in Half Life dedicated server before build 3104 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a long rcon command.

data.name: CVE-2000-1140
data.document: Recourse ManTrap 1.6 does not properly hide processes from attackers, which could allow attackers to determine that they are in a honeypot system by comparing the results from kill commands with the process listing in the /proc filesystem.

data.name: CVE-2000-0872
data.document: explorer.php in PhotoAlbum 0.9.9 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) attack.

data.name: CVE-2000-1133
data.document: Authentix Authentix100 allows remote attackers to bypass authentication by inserting a . (dot) into the URL for a protected directory.

data.name: CVE-2000-0939
data.document: Samba Web Administration Tool (SWAT) in Samba 2.0.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service by repeatedly submitting a nonstandard URL in the GET HTTP request and forcing it to restart.

data.name: CVE-2000-1077
data.document: Buffer overflow in the SHTML logging functionality of iPlanet Web Server 4.x allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a long filename with a .shtml extension.

data.name: CVE-2000-1036
data.document: Directory traversal vulnerability in Extent RBS ISP web server allows remote attackers to read sensitive information via a .. (dot dot) attack on the Image parameter.

data.name: CVE-2000-0911
data.document: IMP 2.2 and earlier allows attackers to read and delete arbitrary files by modifying the attachment_name hidden form variable, which causes IMP to send the file to the attacker as an attachment.

data.name: CVE-2000-1198
data.document: qpopper POP server creates lock files with predictable names, which allows local users to cause a denial of service for other users (lack of mail access) by creating lock files for other mail boxes.

data.name: CVE-2000-0905
data.document: QNX Embedded Resource Manager in Voyager web server 2.01B in the demo disks for QNX 405 allows remote attackers to read sensitive system statistics information via the embedded.html web page.

data.name: CVE-2000-1121
data.document: Buffer overflow in enq command in IBM AIX 4.3.x and earlier may allow local users to execute arbitrary commands via a long -M argument.

data.name: CVE-2000-1169
data.document: OpenSSH SSH client before 2.3.0 does not properly disable X11 or agent forwarding, which could allow a malicious SSH server to gain access to the X11 display and sniff X11 events, or gain access to the ssh-agent.

data.name: CVE-2000-1185
data.document: The telnet proxy in RideWay PN proxy server allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a flood of connections that contain malformed requests.

data.name: CVE-2000-1162
data.document: ghostscript before 5.10-16 allows local users to overwrite files of other users via a symlink attack.

data.name: CVE-2000-1195
data.document: telnet daemon (telnetd) from the Linux netkit package before netkit-telnet-0.16 allows remote attackers to bypass authentication when telnetd is running with the -L command line option.

data.name: CVE-2000-1060
data.document: The default configuration of XFCE 3.5.1 bypasses the Xauthority access control mechanism with an "xhost + localhost" command in the xinitrc program, which allows local users to sniff X Windows traffic and gain privileges.

data.name: CVE-2000-1186
data.document: Buffer overflow in phf CGI program allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands by specifying a large number of arguments and including a long MIME header.

data.name: CVE-2000-1024
data.document: eWave ServletExec 3.0C and earlier does not restrict access to the UploadServlet Java/JSP servlet, which allows remote attackers to upload files and execute arbitrary commands.

data.name: CVE-2000-0915
data.document: fingerd in FreeBSD 4.1.1 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files by specifying the target file name instead of a regular user name.

data.name: CVE-2000-0865
data.document: Buffer overflow in dvtermtype in Tridia Double Vision 3.07.00 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long terminal type argument.

data.name: CVE-2000-0987
data.document: Buffer overflow in oidldapd in Oracle 8.1.6 allow local users to gain privileges via a long "connect" command line parameter.

data.name: CVE-2000-1039
data.document: Various TCP/IP stacks and network applications allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service by flooding a target host with TCP connection attempts and completing the TCP/IP handshake without maintaining the connection state on the attacker host, aka the "NAPTHA" class of vulnerabilities.  NOTE: this candidate may change significantly as the security community discusses the technical nature of NAPTHA and learns more about the affected applications. This candidate is at a higher level of abstraction than is typical for CVE.

data.name: CVE-2000-1124
data.document: Buffer overflow in piobe command in IBM AIX 4.3.x allows local users to gain privileges via long environmental variables.

data.name: CVE-2000-1042
data.document: Buffer overflow in ypserv in Mandrake Linux 7.1 and earlier, and possibly other Linux operating systems, allows an attacker to gain root privileges when ypserv is built without a vsyslog() function.

data.name: CVE-2000-0947
data.document: Format string vulnerability in cfd daemon in GNU CFEngine before 1.6.0a11 allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands via format characters in the CAUTH command.

data.name: CVE-2000-1075
data.document: Directory traversal vulnerability in iPlanet Certificate Management System 4.2 and Directory Server 4.12 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) attack in the Agent, End Entity, or Administrator services.

data.name: CVE-2000-0999
data.document: Format string vulnerabilities in OpenBSD ssh program (and possibly other BSD-based operating systems) allow attackers to gain root privileges.

data.name: CVE-2000-1070
data.document: pollit.cgi in Poll It 2.01 and earlier uses data files that are located under the web document root, which allows remote attackers to access sensitive or private information.

data.name: CVE-2000-0932
data.document: MAILsweeper for SMTP 3.x does not properly handle corrupt CDA documents in a ZIP file and hangs, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service.

data.name: CVE-2000-1047
data.document: Buffer overflow in SMTP service of Lotus Domino 5.0.4 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a long ENVID keyword in the "MAIL FROM" command.

data.name: CVE-2000-1202
data.document: ikeyman in IBM IBMHSSSB 1.0 sets the CLASSPATH environmental variable to include the user's own CLASSPATH directories before the system's directories, which allows a malicious local user to execute arbitrary code as root via a Trojan horse Ikeyman class.

data.name: CVE-2000-0970
data.document: IIS 4.0 and 5.0 .ASP pages send the same Session ID cookie for secure and insecure web sessions, which could allow remote attackers to hijack the secure web session of the user if that user moves to an insecure session, aka the "Session ID Cookie Marking" vulnerability.

data.name: CVE-2000-1005
data.document: Directory traversal vulnerability in html_web_store.cgi and web_store.cgi CGI programs in eXtropia WebStore allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) attack on the page parameter.

data.name: CVE-2000-1123
data.document: Buffer overflow in pioout command in IBM AIX 4.3.x and earlier may allow local users to execute arbitrary commands.

data.name: CVE-2000-1030
data.document: CS&T CorporateTime for the Web returns different error messages for invalid usernames and invalid passwords, which allows remote attackers to determine valid usernames on the server.

data.name: CVE-2000-1074
data.document: csstart program in iCal 2.1 Patch 2 uses relative pathnames to install the libsocket and libnsl libraries, which could allow the icsuser account to gain root privileges by creating a Trojan Horse library in the current or parent directory.

data.name: CVE-2000-1243
data.document: Privacy leak in Dansie Shopping Cart 3.04, and probably earlier versions, sends sensitive information such as user credentials to an e-mail address controlled by the product developers.

data.name: CVE-2000-1141
data.document: Recourse ManTrap 1.6 modifies the kernel so that ".." does not appear in the /proc listing, which allows attackers to determine that they are in a honeypot system.

data.name: CVE-2000-0351
data.document: Some packaging commands in SCO UnixWare 7.1.0 have insecure privileges, which allows local users to add or remove software packages.

data.name: CVE-2000-1003
data.document: NETBIOS client in Windows 95 and Windows 98 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service by changing a file sharing service to return an unknown driver type, which causes the client to crash.

data.name: CVE-2000-1006
data.document: Microsoft Exchange Server 5.5 does not properly handle a MIME header with a blank charset specified, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a charset="" command, aka the "Malformed MIME Header" vulnerability.

data.name: CVE-2000-1212
data.document: Zope 2.2.0 through 2.2.4 does not properly protect a data updating method on Image and File objects, which allows attackers with DTML editing privileges to modify the raw data of these objects.

data.name: CVE-2000-1187
data.document: Buffer overflow in the HTML parser for Netscape 4.75 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a long password value in a form field.

data.name: CVE-2000-0930
data.document: Pegasus Mail 3.12 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via an embedded URL that calls the mailto: protocol with a -F switch.

data.name: CVE-2000-1051
data.document: Directory traversal vulnerability in Allaire JRun 2.3 server allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via the SSIFilter servlet.

data.name: CVE-2000-1223
data.document: quikstore.cgi in Quikstore Shopping Cart allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in the URL portion of an HTTP GET request.

data.name: CVE-2000-1064
data.document: Buffer overflow in the LPD service in HP JetDirect printer card Firmware x.08.20 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service.

data.name: CVE-2000-1114
data.document: Unify ServletExec AS v3.0C allows remote attackers to read source code for JSP pages via an HTTP request that ends with characters such as ".", or "+", or "%20".

data.name: CVE-2000-1196
data.document: PSCOErrPage.htm in Netscape PublishingXpert 2.5 before SP2 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files by specifying the target file in the errPagePath parameter.

data.name: CVE-2000-0313

data.name: CVE-2000-0982
data.document: Internet Explorer before 5.5 forwards cached user credentials for a secure web site to insecure pages on the same web site, which could allow remote attackers to obtain the credentials by monitoring connections to the web server, aka the "Cached Web Credentials" vulnerability.

data.name: CVE-2000-0368
data.document: Classic Cisco IOS 9.1 and later allows attackers with access to the login prompt to obtain portions of the command history of previous users, which may allow the attacker to access sensitive data.

data.name: CVE-2000-0948
data.document: GnoRPM before 0.95 allows local users to modify arbitrary files via a symlink attack.

data.name: CVE-2000-1072
data.document: iCal 2.1 Patch 2 installs many files with world-writeable permissions, which allows local users to modify the iCal configuration and execute arbitrary commands by replacing the iplncal.sh program with a Trojan horse.

data.name: CVE-2000-0258
data.document: IIS 4.0 and 5.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service by sending many URLs with a large number of escaped characters, aka the "Myriad Escaped Characters" Vulnerability.

data.name: CVE-2000-0971
data.document: Avirt Mail 4.0 and 4.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a long "RCPT TO" or "MAIL FROM" command.

data.name: CVE-2000-0951
data.document: A misconfiguration in IIS 5.0 with Index Server enabled and the Index property set allows remote attackers to list directories in the web root via a Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV) search.

data.name: CVE-2000-1240
data.document: Unspecified vulnerability in siteman.php3 in AnyPortal(php) before 22 APR 00 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via unknown attack vectors, which reveal the absolute path.  NOTE: the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained from third party information.

data.name: CVE-2000-1083

data.name: CVE-2000-0994
data.document: Format string vulnerability in OpenBSD fstat program (and possibly other BSD-based operating systems) allows local users to gain root privileges via the PWD environmental variable.

data.name: CVE-2000-1165

data.name: CVE-2000-1046
data.document: Multiple buffer overflows in the ESMTP service of Lotus Domino 5.0.2c and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via long (1) "RCPT TO," (2) "SAML FROM," or (3) "SOML FROM" commands.

data.name: CVE-2000-0880
data.document: LPPlus creates the lpdprocess file with world-writeable permissions, which allows local users to kill arbitrary processes by specifying an alternate process ID and using the setuid dcclpdshut program to kill the process that was specified in the lpdprocess file.

data.name: CVE-2000-1130

data.name: CVE-2000-0936

data.name: CVE-2000-0925

data.name: CVE-2000-1104
data.document: Variant of the "IIS Cross-Site Scripting" vulnerability as originally discussed in MS:MS00-060 (CVE-2000-0746) allows a malicious web site operator to embed scripts in a link to a trusted site, which are returned without quoting in an error message back to the client.  The client then executes those scripts in the same context as the trusted site.

data.name: CVE-2000-0927
data.document: WQuinn QuotaAdvisor 4.1 does not properly record file sizes if they are stored in alternative data streams, which allows users to bypass quota restrictions.

data.name: CVE-2000-0892
data.document: Some telnet clients allow remote telnet servers to request environment variables from the client that may contain sensitive information, or remote web servers to obtain the information via a telnet: URL.

data.name: CVE-2000-0499

data.name: CVE-2000-0992
data.document: Directory traversal vulnerability in scp in sshd 1.2.xx allows a remote malicious scp server to overwrite arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) attack.

data.name: CVE-2000-0882
data.document: Intel Express 500 series switches allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via a malformed ICMP packet, which causes the CPU to crash.

data.name: CVE-2000-1194
data.document: Argosoft FRP server 1.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service, and possibly execute arbitrary commands, via a long string to the (1) USER or (2) CWD commands.

data.name: CVE-2000-1092

data.name: CVE-2000-0349

data.name: CVE-2000-0946

data.name: CVE-2000-0972

data.name: CVE-2000-0912
data.document: MultiHTML CGI script allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files and possibly execute arbitrary commands by specifying the file name to the "multi" parameter.

data.name: CVE-2000-1085
data.document: The xp_peekqueue function in Microsoft SQL Server 2000 and SQL Server Desktop Engine (MSDE) does not properly restrict the length of a buffer before calling the srv_paraminfo function in the SQL Server API for Extended Stored Procedures (XP), which allows an attacker to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary commands, aka the "Extended Stored Procedure Parameter Parsing" vulnerability.

data.name: CVE-2000-1098

data.name: CVE-2000-0906

data.name: CVE-2000-1166

data.name: CVE-2000-0846
data.document: Buffer overflow in Darxite 0.4 and earlier allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands via a long username or password.

data.name: CVE-2000-1073
data.document: csstart program in iCal 2.1 Patch 2 searches for the cshttpd program in the current working directory, which allows local users to gain root privileges by creating a Trojan Horse cshttpd program in a directory and calling csstart from that directory.

data.name: CVE-2000-0898
data.document: Small HTTP Server 2.01 does not properly process Server Side Includes (SSI) tags that contain null values, which allows local users, and possibly remote attackers, to cause the server to crash by inserting the SSI into an HTML file.

data.name: CVE-2000-1154
data.document: RHConsole in RobinHood 1.1 web server in BeOS r5 pro and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via long HTTP request.

data.name: CVE-2000-0866
data.document: Interbase 6 SuperServer for Linux allows an attacker to cause a denial of service via a query containing 0 bytes.

data.name: CVE-2000-0986
data.document: Buffer overflow in Oracle 8.1.5 applications such as names, namesctl, onrsd, osslogin, tnslsnr, tnsping, trcasst, and trcroute possibly allow local users to gain privileges via a long ORACLE_HOME environmental variable.

data.name: CVE-2000-1116
data.document: Buffer overflow in TransSoft Broker FTP Server before 4.3.0.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a long command.

data.name: CVE-2000-0924

data.name: CVE-2000-0307

data.name: CVE-2000-1095

data.name: CVE-2000-0969
data.document: Format string vulnerability in Half Life dedicated server build 3104 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands by injecting format strings into the changelevel command, via the system console or rcon.

data.name: CVE-2000-1076
data.document: Netscape (iPlanet) Certificate Management System 4.2 and Directory Server 4.12 stores the administrative password in plaintext, which could allow local and possibly remote attackers to gain administrative privileges on the server.

data.name: CVE-2000-1210
data.document: Directory traversal vulnerability in source.jsp of Apache Tomcat before 3.1 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) in the argument to source.jsp.

data.name: CVE-2000-1043
data.document: Format string vulnerability in ypserv in Mandrake Linux 7.1 and earlier, and possibly other Linux operating systems, allows an attacker to gain root privileges when ypserv is built without a vsyslog() function.

data.name: CVE-2000-1089
data.document: Buffer overflow in Microsoft Phone Book Service allows local users to execute arbitrary commands, aka the "Phone Book Service Buffer Overflow" vulnerability.

data.name: CVE-2000-1167

data.name: CVE-2000-1172
data.document: Buffer overflow in Gaim 0.10.3 and earlier using the OSCAR protocol allows remote attackers to conduct a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a long HTML tag.

data.name: CVE-2000-1152
data.document: Browser IRC client in BeOS r5 pro and earlier allows remote attackers to conduct a denial of service via a message that contains a long URL.

data.name: CVE-2000-1224
data.document: Caucho Technology Resin 1.2 and possibly earlier allows remote attackers to view JSP source via an HTTP request to a .jsp file with certain characters appended to the file name, such as (1) "..", (2) "%2e..", (3) "%81", (4) "%82", and others.

data.name: CVE-2000-1153
data.document: PostMaster 1.0 in BeOS r5 pro and earlier allows remote attackers to conduct a denial of service via a message that contains a long URL.

data.name: CVE-2000-1149

data.name: CVE-2000-1182

data.name: CVE-2000-1048
data.document: Directory traversal vulnerability in the logfile service of Wingate 4.1 Beta A and earlier allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) attack via an HTTP GET request that uses encoded characters in the URL.

data.name: CVE-2000-1168
data.document: IBM HTTP Server 1.3.6 (based on Apache) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a long GET request.

data.name: CVE-2000-1238
data.document: BEA Systems WebLogic Express and WebLogic Server 5.1 SP1-SP6 allows remote attackers to bypass access controls for restricted JSP or servlet pages via a URL with multiple / (forward slash) characters before the restricted pages.

data.name: CVE-2000-1180
data.document: Buffer overflow in cmctl program in Oracle 8.1.5 Connection Manager Control allows local users to gain privileges via a long command line argument.

data.name: CVE-2000-0949
data.document: Heap overflow in savestr function in LBNL traceroute 1.4a5 and earlier allows a local user to execute arbitrary commands via the -g option.

data.name: CVE-2000-0860

data.name: CVE-2000-1037
data.document: Check Point Firewall-1 session agent 3.0 through 4.1 generates different error messages for invalid user names versus invalid passwords, which allows remote attackers to determine valid usernames and guess a password via a brute force attack.

data.document: Format string vulnerability in AOL Instant Messenger (AIM) 4.1.2010 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands by transferring a file whose name includes format characters.

data.name: CVE-2000-1068

data.name: CVE-2000-1155
data.document: RHDaemon in RobinHood 1.1 web server in BeOS r5 pro and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via long HTTP request.

data.name: CVE-2000-1057
data.document: Vulnerabilities in database configuration scripts in HP OpenView Network Node Manager (NNM) 6.1 and earlier allows local users to gain privileges, possibly via insecure permissions.

data.name: CVE-2000-1094

data.name: CVE-2000-1022
data.document: The mailguard feature in Cisco Secure PIX Firewall 5.2(2) and earlier does not properly restrict access to SMTP commands, which allows remote attackers to execute restricted commands by sending a DATA command before sending the restricted commands.

data.name: CVE-2000-1029
data.document: Buffer overflow in host command allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands via a long response to an AXFR query.

data.document: cons.saver in Midnight Commander (mc) 4.5.42 and earlier does not properly verify if an output file descriptor is a TTY, which allows local users to corrupt files by creating a symbolic link to the target file, calling mc, and specifying that link as a TTY argument.

data.name: CVE-2000-1131

data.name: CVE-2000-1176
data.document: Directory traversal vulnerability in YaBB search.pl CGI script allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) attack in the "catsearch" form field.

data.name: CVE-2000-0980
data.document: NMPI (Name Management Protocol on IPX) listener in Microsoft NWLink does not properly filter packets from a broadcast address, which allows remote attackers to cause a broadcast storm and flood the network.

data.name: CVE-2000-1093
data.document: Buffer overflow in AOL Instant Messenger before 4.3.2229 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a long "goim" command.

data.name: CVE-2000-0995
data.document: Format string vulnerability in OpenBSD yp_passwd program (and possibly other BSD-based operating systems) allows attackers to gain root privileges a malformed name.

data.name: CVE-2000-0890
data.document: periodic in FreeBSD 4.1.1 and earlier, and possibly other operating systems, allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack.

data.name: CVE-2000-1014
data.document: Format string vulnerability in the search97.cgi CGI script in SCO help http server for Unixware 7 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via format characters in the queryText parameter.

data.name: CVE-2000-1008
data.document: PalmOS 3.5.2 and earlier uses weak encryption to store the user password, which allows attackers with physical access to the Palm device to decrypt the password and gain access to the device.

data.name: CVE-2000-1197
data.document: POP2 or POP3 server (pop3d) in imap-uw IMAP package on FreeBSD and other operating systems creates lock files with predictable names, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (lack of mail access) for other users by creating lock files for other mail boxes.

data.name: CVE-2000-0851

data.name: CVE-2000-1100

data.name: CVE-2000-0943
data.document: Buffer overflow in bftp daemon (bftpd) 1.0.11 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a long USER command.

data.name: CVE-2000-0875
data.document: WFTPD and WFTPD Pro 2.41 RC12 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service by sending a long string of unprintable characters.

data.name: CVE-2000-0940
data.document: Directory traversal vulnerability in Metertek pagelog.cgi allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) attack on the "name" or "display" parameter.

data.name: CVE-2000-0874
data.document: Eudora mail client includes the absolute path of the sender's host within a virtual card (VCF).

data.name: CVE-2000-1191
data.document: htsearch program in htDig 3.2 beta, 3.1.6, 3.1.5, and earlier allows remote attackers to determine the physical path of the server by requesting a non-existent configuration file using the config parameter, which generates an error message that includes the full path.

data.name: CVE-2000-1179

data.name: CVE-2000-1119

data.name: CVE-2000-0818

data.name: CVE-2000-1161

data.name: CVE-2000-1156

data.name: CVE-2000-0310

data.name: CVE-2000-1015
